required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Antithrombin III in Infectious Disease Caused by COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: Antithrombin III (AT3) in Infectious Disease Caused by Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 (SARS-COV-2)/ Coronavirus Disease of 2019 (COVID-19)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to see if participants who have SARS-CoV-2 and low levels of AT3 in the blood will benefit by being given AT3.

primary_outcome.description: As measured by the International Society of Thrombosis and Haemostasis Disseminated Intravascular Coagulation scale (ISTH DIC) which has a total score ranging from 0-8 with a score of 5 and higher indicating overt DIC.

secondary_outcome.description: D-Dimer levels assessed from blood samples will be evaluated in mcg/ml D-Dimer Units (DDU)
Fibrinogen levels assessed from blood samples will be evaluated in mg/dL Fibrinogen Equivalent Units (FEU).
Prothrombin time assessed from blood samples will be evaluated in seconds.
Length of Hospital Stay reported in days.
Pulmonary Function will be reported as the days the participant was on any of the following: mechanical ventilation or Extracorporeal Membrane Oxygenation (ECMO) use.
Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) is scored from 0-4 with the higher score indicating more organ failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in SOFA Respiratory Sub Score
secondary_outcome.description: SOFA Respiratory Sub Score is scored from 0-4 with the higher score indicating worse organ failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Incidences of venous thromboembolism
secondary_outcome.description: Number of incidences of venous thromboembolisms from admission to hospital discharge.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of incidences of major bleeding
secondary_outcome.description: Number of incidences of major bleeding from admission to hospital discharge.

arm_group.arm_group_label: AT3 less than 100% with SOC plus AT3 supplement
arm_group.description: Participants in this group, with endogenous Antithrombin lll less than 100%, will receive 5 doses of supplemental Antithrombin III on Days 1, 3, 5, 7 and 9, in addition to standard of care (SOC) treatment.

arm_group.arm_group_label: AT3 less than 100% with SOC only
arm_group.description: Participants in this group, with endogenous Antithrombin III less than 100%, will receive SOC treatment only.

arm_group.arm_group_label: AT3 more than 100% with SOC only
arm_group.description: Participants in this group, with endogenous Antithrombin III more than 100%, will receive SOC treatment only.

intervention.description: Five total doses of daily 1,821 to 9,100 IUs Antithrombin III, depending on participant's weight, will be administered intravenously every other infusion day (Days 1, 3, 5, 7 and 9).
intervention.arm_group_label: AT3 less than 100% with SOC plus AT3 supplement

criteria.textblock:
INCLUSION CRITERIA:
1. >18y of age,
2. Subject or proxy who can provide informed consent
3. Positive SARS-COV-2 by Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) or as determined by clinical team
EXCLUSION CRITERIA:
1. Adults or Proxy unable to consent
2. Individuals who are not yet adults (infants, children, teenagers)
3. Pregnant women
4. Prisoners
5. Patients expected to die within 24 hours or with a "do not resuscitate" order,
6. Multi-organ failure,
7. History of hypersensitivity or allergy to any component of the study drug,
8. Ongoing massive surgical or unexplained bleeding,
9. History of bleeding or clotting disorder,
10. Severe traumatic brain injury (Glasgow Coma Scale <6),
11. Spinal or multiple-trauma,
12. Cancer (incurable/terminal phase) and/or patients receiving palliative care,
13. Enrollment in another concurrent clinical interventional study if considered interfering with this study objectives
14. Per study team discretion, any condition(s) that may prevent safe treatment, preclude adequate evaluation or adding further risk to their underlying illness.
